item.title: Validating Untrusted Input: Numbers
item.description: Validating untrusted input safely is critical for application security: SQL injection, XSS and malicious file upload are common attacks which succeed because the user’s input is not vetted correctly. Numbers are problematic: negative numbers (“the sales price was -$500”), very large numbers (“my account balance is 9,223,372,036,854,775,807”) or not-a-number (“rm -rf /") can all wreak havoc if not handled with care. Fortunately, Perl has robust capabilities for validating input but there are some edge cases to be aware of that make answering “is $x a number?
